comment: Out of touch with students and reality.
Amazing teacher! She is very helpful and aspires for you to pass. Do what she asks and you will pass easily. Gives plenty of extra credit. Is there for you in and out of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Needs everything to be done perfectly her way but doesn't give specific instructions. She grades off people more than their work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Lynn is a very sweet lady and genuinely cares about all of her students. She takes the time to get to know her students and makes sure everyone is adjusting well. We also got chicken minis and cake at the end of the semester. But in all of that being said, she gives a lot of assignments and papers and the class was very burdensome and too serious.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Lynn is a real genuine lady and you can tell she really cares about her students. However, she is a real tough grader. I expected Freshman Seminar to be my easiest class first semester, but it ended up being my hardest. She gives you a lot of work outside of class and gives a lot of major assignments that lower your grade. Do not take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She means well for her students and is a caring lady, but she takes her class way too seriously. It's a seminar class and it's supposed to be an easy A, but instead she grades very harshly and gives a bunch of unnecessary busy work. Her final study guide includes 14 short essay questions and 85 terms if that tells you anything... Do not take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is a very nice lady with the best intentions for her students. She is very passionate about her class which you think may be good but no. It's a freshman seminar class, its supposed to be a joke. She grades my papers harder than my English teacher. Take the course online and do a fraction of the work for an easy A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Nice lady overall, Lynn really cares about her students. However, takes this class too seriously. Easy A IF you do all of the work. She also requires 2 volunteer hours and you must go to 4 campus events.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is crazy. She gives assignments out left and right and their all very pointless and time consuming.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great woman, but if you dont do the work you will not make the desired grade. This class isnt for procrastinators or lazy students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great professor and super friendly. Pop quizzes happened a lot and she gives a lot of work but also a lot of extra credit. Always makes sure everyone is doing okay and adjusting well to college. She makes you feel special and is a great person.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: If you come to class and do your work you will pass. Professor Palazzo helps here students a lot. She gives a ton of extra credit opportunities. Gives study guides to prepare for mid-term and final. Overall really enjoyed this class and learned a lot from it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Would take again

comment: I would strongly advise to switch classes immediately. I typically do very well in my classes and do not mind having to work for my grades, but she is just ridiculous. This class is already such a joke, but to get a professor who makes it even worse will only make your life harder. This is your warning, switch while you still can.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Prof. Palazzo is an amazing teacher. Shes specific about what she wants and is really easy to talk to. I had her class as at 8am and i would definitely take it again. Also gives us free chicken minis at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She allows 3 Absences, Most lectures are solely based on the text, and projects aren't hard (that is if you can handle high school level work). People have had terrible experiences with this class and it's mostly due to their own apathy, participate in class and you'll be fine
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Palazzo is a very sweet lady. She really cares about her students and their success. However, she takes this class way too seriously. She requires you go to four campus events and volunteer for two hours but it has to be done in a specific way and she was very unclear about how she wanted things done. Will give extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very nice lady overall, but it seemed as though she took this class too seriously, extremely tough grader. Her pop-quizzes came from small details from the text that could be easily looked over. Assigns a lot of work for the class just to be a freshman seminar.  Grades you throughout semester on in-class participation.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Palazzo is a nice person but the pop quizzes and tremendous amount of work really hurt. You are required to do lots of work outside class (INCLUDING MEETING TWICE A WEEK OUTSIDE CLASS FOR LIKE FIVE WEEKS FOR A GROUP PROJECT AND HAVING MANDATORY VOLUNTEER HOURS. BOTH ARE RIGHT DURING FINALS BUT NEITHER COUNT AS A FINAL).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: If you show up for class and do all of the assignments you can make an A. If you tell her and give her good feedback on what you don't like or what could better about the class she will work will you to fix it. Overall she's a nice lady but participation in the class counts, so if you don't show up or sit back in class it's going to be miserable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Will not make any exceptions for students with handwritten work. Claims to be understanding and "about the students" but will not help you truly succeed. Piles on busy work and takes the class so seriously when the course is meant to teach you crucial study skills that will help you in the long run. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She is very nice and cares about her students but she takes this class way too serious.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Lynn is a nice lady that loves her job. The book is necessary as when she tells us to read a chapter, we'll have a pop quiz the next class. She does powerpoints that we need to take notes on. She's positive and cares for us. A lot of grades, but mostly easy assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER!! even if it is your last option, wait for somebody to drop another class. she is rude and belittles you if you ask a question, especially in front of the class. and theres SO much work to do. do not take her. ever.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I feel that is my civic duty to warn you not to take this professor. Lynn Palazzo takes a course that is supposed to be fun and easy and turns it into a living nightmare with piles of meaningless work. The grade I made in this class is the product  of many tearful sleepless nights. If you value your sanity avoid this course.
Terrible teacher. No help. DON'T TAKE HER.
Assigns a ridiculous amount of work and lectures feel like they last for hours. Makes the class so much more work than it needs to be
Don't take her, she is awful. She gives you too much work for just a seminar class. Expect lots of papers due. Including a ten page essay.
She takes the class WAY too seriously and assigns too much outside-of -class work
She's super nice but too much work for just a seminar class. She talks the WHOLE time and is confusing about assignments.
She is a terrible teacher and tries to make a meaningless class hard.  She rambles on and on and give a lot of work.  She is the worst teacher ever. Do not take her

The class is SO stupid. If you have a choice, do NOT take her. She makes the class so much harder than it has to be. She makes it pretty impossible to make up assignments. Her tests are over small details of the chapter and not the main points. She is kind of strange and laughs at her own jokes. Be prepared for a lot of awkward silence during class

This is worst class I have ever taken. She acts like this class is the most important one we have and assigns crazy amount of work that's due on the same days. She  will do nothing to help your grade if you happen to miss one thing. She acts like the syllabus is the bible and has changed it 4 times already in the semester.  Do not take her class.

Changes her mind about assignments a lot. Every other freshman I know brags how they do nothing in their Freshman Seminar class. Not the case with this professor. You have assignments on stuff you might never need to know about. Do not take.

Do not think this class is an easy A if you take her. Her tests and quizzes are difficult and she grades pretty harshly. I had more work to do in this class than any of my other classes and she does not do a good job of explaining assignments. Everything you do is pointless and to me it was a waste of my time.
